tatami.core.interfaces

Interface JadeInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PCJadeInterface

    public interface JadeInterface
    There should be at one JadeInterface instance per machine.
    Author:
    Andrei Olaru, with snippets from the code of Marius-Tudor Benea

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  JadeInterface.JadeConfig

      Method which creates and starts an agent in a container specified by its name

      Fills in the configuration settings that are default for the platform.

      This is the actual constructing function.

    • Method Detail

      • fillConfig

        JadeInterface.JadeConfig fillConfig(JadeInterface.JadeConfig configuration)
        Fills in the configuration settings that are default for the platform.
        Parameters:
        configuration - : the configuration object to fill
        Returns:
        the same object as the argument

      • setConfig

        JadeInterface setConfig(JadeInterface.JadeConfig configuration)
        This is the actual constructing function. Call this after constructing, filling config, and setting favorite config params.
        Parameters:
        configuration -
        Returns:

      • startPlatform

        JadeInterface startPlatform()
        Creates the main container. On platforms that cannot contain the main container, it should return an IllegalOperationException.
        Returns:
        this

      • startContainer

        void startContainer(java.lang.String containerName)
        Method used by createContainer methods in order to start a container, having the name of the container specified and supporting null arguments. Not to be used for the main container.
        Parameters:
        containerName - - the name of the container

      • addAgentToContainer

        void addAgentToContainer(java.lang.String containerName,
                       java.lang.String agentName,
                       java.lang.String agentClassName,
                       java.lang.Object[] agentArgs)
        Method which creates and starts an agent in a container specified by its name
        Parameters:
        containerName - - the name of the container; null for the main container - should be on the same machine
        agentName - - the name of the agent
        agentClassName - - the class of the agent, including the package
        agentArgs - - array of Objects, representing the arguments of the agent

      • getMainContainerName

        java.lang.String getMainContainerName()
        Returns:
        the name of the main container, if any.
